info.description:
ProfitBricks provides an enterprise-grade Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) solution that can be managed through a browser-based "Data Center Designer" (DCD) tool or via an easy to use API. 

The API allows you to perform a variety of management tasks such as spinning up additional servers, adding volumes, adjusting networking, and so forth. It is designed to allow users to leverage the same power and flexibility found within the DCD visual tool. Both tools are consistent with their concepts and lend well to making the experience smooth and intuitive.
info.title: Profitbricks Resources REST API

get.description: Display API information

X-RateLimit-Burst.description: Maximum number of concurrent API requests allowed

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: Average number of requests allowed per minute

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of requests which can still be made without triggering a failure response.

get.description: You can retrieve a complete list of data centers provisioned under your account

X-RateLimit-Burst.description: Maximum number of concurrent API requests allowed

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: Average number of requests allowed per minute

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of requests which can still be made without triggering a failure response.

post.description: Virtual data centers are the foundation of the ProfitBricks platform. VDCs act as logical containers for all other objects you will be creating, e.g. servers. You can provision as many data centers as you want. Datacenters have their own private network and are logically segmented from each other to create isolation. You can use this POST method to create a simple datacenter or to create a datacenter with multiple objects under it such as servers and storage volumes.

Location.description: Callback URL to poll async operation status

X-RateLimit-Burst.description: Maximum number of concurrent API requests allowed

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: Average number of requests allowed per minute

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of requests which can still be made without triggering a failure response.

post.description: This will force a hard reboot of the server. Do not use this method if you want to gracefully reboot the machine. This is the equivalent of powering off the machine and turning it back on.
This will start a server. If the server's public IP was deallocated then a new IP will be assigned
This will stop a server. The machine will be forcefully powered off, billing will cease, and the public IP, if one is allocated, will be deallocated.

basicAuth.description: You will need to base64 encode the string containing your credentials. Separate your username and password with a colon, i.e., username:password and send it as 'Authorization' request header. More details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication

nicHotUnplug.description: Is capable of nic hot unplug (no reboot required)

discVirtioHotPlug.description: Is capable of Virt-IO drive hot plug (no reboot required)

discVirtioHotUnplug.description: Is capable of Virt-IO drive hot unplug (no reboot required)

discScsiHotPlug.description: Is capable of SCSI drive hot plug (no reboot required)

discScsiHotUnplug.description: Is capable of SCSI drive hot unplug (no reboot required)

imageType.description: This indicates the type of image

public.description: Indicates if the image is part of the public repository or not

type.description: The type of object that has been created

href.description: URL to the objects representation (absolute path)

items.description: Array of items in that collection

protocol.description: The protocol for the rule. Property cannot be modified after creation (disallowed in update requests)

sourceMac.description: Only traffic originating from the respective MAC address is allowed. Valid format: aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff. Value null allows all source MAC address

sourceIp.description: Only traffic originating from the respective IPv4 address is allowed. Value null allows all source IPs

targetIp.description: In case the target NIC has multiple IP addresses, only traffic directed to the respective IP address of the NIC is allowed. Value null allows all target IPs

icmpCode.description: Defines the allowed code (from 0 to 254) if protocol ICMP is chosen. Value null allows all codes

icmpType.description: Defines the allowed type (from 0 to 254) if the protocol ICMP is chosen. Value null allows all types

portRangeStart.description: Defines the start range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65534) if protocol TCP or UDP is chosen. Leave portRangeStart and portRangeEnd value null to allow all ports

portRangeEnd.description: Defines the end range of the allowed port (from 1 to 65534) if the protocol TCP or UDP is chosen. Leave portRangeStart and portRangeEnd null to allow all ports

size.description: The size of the image in GB

cpuHotPlug.description: Is capable of CPU hot plug (no reboot required)

cpuHotUnplug.description: Is capable of CPU hot unplug (no reboot required)

ramHotPlug.description: Is capable of memory hot plug (no reboot required)

ramHotUnplug.description: Is capable of memory hot unplug (no reboot required)

discScsiHotPlug.description: Is capable of SCSI drive hot plug (no reboot required)

discScsiHotUnplug.description: Is capable of SCSI drive hot unplug (no reboot required)

firewallrules.description: Collection of firewall rules for that nic

createdDate.description: The last time the resource was created

createdBy.description: The user who created the resource.

etag.description: Resource's Entity Tag as defined in http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.11 . Entity Tag is also added as an 'ETag response header to requests which don't use 'depth' parameter.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time the resource has been modified

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the resource.

state.description: State of the resource. *AVAILABLE* There are no pending modification requests for this item; *BUSY* There is at least one modification request pending and all following requests will be queued; *INACTIVE* Resource has been de-provisioned.

type.description: Hardware type of the volume. Default is HDD

size.description: The size of the volume in GB

image.description: Image or snapshot ID to be used as template for this volume

imagePassword.description: Initial password to be set for installed OS. Works with Profitbricks public images only. Not modifiable, forbidden in update requests

bus.description: The bus type of the volume. Default is VIRTIO

cpuHotPlug.description: Is capable of CPU hot plug (no reboot required)

cpuHotUnplug.description: Is capable of CPU hot unplug (no reboot required)

deviceNumber.description: The LUN ID of the storage volume. Null for volumes not mounted to any VM

entities.description: Attached children and references. May be included in create calls. Disallowed in update calls

description.description: A description for the datacenter, e.g. staging, production

location.description: The physical location where the datacenter will be created. This will be where all of your servers live. Property cannot be modified after datacenter creation (disallowed in update requests)

version.description: The version of that Data Center. Gets incremented with every change

size.description: The size of the IP block

mac.description: The MAC address of the NIC

ips.description: Collection of IP addresses assigned to a nic. Explicitly assigned public IPs need to come from reserved IP blocks, Passing value null or empty array will assign an IP address automatically.

dhcp.description: Indicates if the nic will reserve an IP using DHCP

lan.description: The LAN ID the NIC will sit on. If the LAN ID does not exist it will be implicitly created

firewallActive.description: Once you add a firewall rule this will reflect a true value. Can also be used to temporarily disable a firewall without losing defined rules.

cores.description: The total number of cores for the server

ram.description: The amount of memory for the server in MB, e.g. 2048. Size must be specified in multiples of 256 MB with a minimum of 256 MB; however, if you set ramHotPlug to TRUE then you must use a minimum of 1024 MB

availabilityZone.description: The availability zone in which the server should exist

bootCdrom.description: Reference to a CD-ROM used for booting. If not 'null' then bootVolume has to be 'null'

bootVolume.description: Reference to a Volume used for booting. If not 'null' then bootCdrom has to be 'null'

pretty.name: Pretty print query parameter
pretty.description: Controls whether response is pretty-printed (with indentation and new lines)

depth.name: depth
depth.description:
Controls the details depth of response objects. 
Eg. GET /datacenters/[ID]
	- depth=0: only direct properties are included. Children (servers etc.) are not included
	- depth=1: direct properties and children references are included
	- depth=2: direct properties and children properties are included
	- depth=3: direct properties and children properties and children's children are included
	- depth=... and so on

apiError.description: Any erroneous status code: 400 (parse error), 401 (auth error), 402 (trial access), 403 (insufficient permissions), 404 (not found), 405 (unsupported HTTP method), 415 (unsupported content type, 422 (validation error), 429 (request rate limit exceeded), 500 (server error), 503 (maintenance)
